channel.title: astrophotography on walking in the woods
channel.description: Recent content in astrophotography on walking in the woods

item.title: Soul Nebula
item.description: Westerhout 5, or known by most as Soul Nebula, is an emission nebula located in Cassiopeia. This is a large star forming region like the Orion Nebula. The dark hollow areas embedded in the blue regions are cavities that were carved out by radiation and winds from the region’s massive stars.

item.title: Squid Nebula
item.description: SH2-129 Flying Bat (red) and OU-4 Squid Nebulae. The combo can be found in the constellation Cepheus. Both are in the family of emission nebula. The Flying Bat consists of mostly ionized hydrogen gas while the Squid is a region full of ionized oxygen clouds. Due to its extremely dimness, the Squid was discovered only recently in 2011 by French astrophotographer Nicolas Outters. The formation of the Squid is still under debate. But many astronomers believe the bright star HD202214 at the center of the frame plays a major role.

item.title: Horsehead Nebula
item.description: IC434 Horsehead Nebula. This nebula is probably one of the most imaged subject in astrophotography. IC434 is a dark nebula in the constellation Orion. It is about 1375 light years away from Earth. The nebula got its name because the dark dust cloud looks just like a horse’s head. Behind the Horsehead nebula is a huge area of ionized hydrogen gas lit up by the star group Sigma Orions (at the top of the image)
